business.headline: Budget 2025: 5 top middle-class expectations for tax relief and savings growthExperts suggest scrapping the old tax regime and rationalising the income tax slabs under the new regime, would go a long way in making income tax simpler.

8th Pay Commission may give a 186% boost to pensions. Find out how The fitment factor plays an important role in calculating the updated pay and benefits and is likely to be in the range between 2.28 and 2.86 for the 8th Pay Commission.

Stuck in middle-income trap: Fareed Zakaria decodes China's economic crisisFareed Zakaria said that China's economy is not going to grow any time at the six, seven, eight percent that it was growing at previously.
How to achieve minimum credit score for getting personal loan? Details hereThe higher the credit score, the greater are the chances for the approval of your loan requests.

InterGlobe Aviation Q3 results: IndiGo operator's net profit falls by 18%Indigo Q3 results: The net profit for the aviation company dropped by 18% to Rs 2,449 crore when compared to Rs 2,998 crore in the same quarter a year ago.

Amul cuts milk prices by Re 1 per litre across IndiaThe reduction will only be applicable to 1-litre packs. Previously, in June 2024, Amul had increased milk prices by Rs 2 per litre.

Cyient share price falls 20% to hit 52-week low. What triggered Friday's crash?Cyient stock price: At around 10:21 am, shares of Cyient were down 17.96% to Rs 1,438 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). In early trade, shares of the IT company fell as much as 20% to hit a 52-week low of Rs 1,402.25.

Explained: Why Dr Reddy's share price cracked 6% in early tradeDr Reddy's Laboratories Stock Price: Dr Reddy's shares tumbled up to 6% in early trade and at 9:46 am, they were trading 4.35% lower at Rs 1,233.25 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Sensex, Nifty open higher tracking Asian markets; energy stocks gainShare Market Today, 24 January 2025: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 204.76 points to 76,725.14 at 9:17 am, while the NSE Nify50 traded 64.15 points higher at 23,269.50.

Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw says manufacturing, services, AI to drive growthAt the World Economic Forum, Minister Ashwini Vaishnav outlined India's economic strategy based on four pillars: public investment in infrastructure, focus on manufacturing and innovation, inclusive growth, and simplification of laws.

entertainment.headline: Stranger Things 5 out in November? Eagle-eyed fans spot release dateStranger Things fans may have discovered the release date for the fifth season through a Netflix code. The show will reportedly be released in November 2025.

Guru Randhawa visits Maha Kumbh: Blessed to take a sacred dip in Maa GangaSinger Guru Randhawa visited the Maha Kumbh Mela 2025 in Prayagraj and took a sacred dip in the Ganga. He wrote about starting a new journey.

Suits LA trailer: Stephen Amell takes you to 'west coast', Harvey Spector reappearsThe trailer of Suits LA teased actor Gabriel Macht's return as Harvey Spector in the new spin-off series. Actor Stephen Amell leads the show, which is going to be premiered next month.

Coldplay's Chris Martin enjoys scooter ride in Ahmedabad ahead of concertColdplay's Chris Martin made a memorable entrance in Ahmedabad by arriving on a scooter. The iconic rock band is scheduled to perform at the Narendra Modi Stadium on January 25 and 26.

Identity OTT release: When and where to watch Tovino Thomas, Trisha's thrillerIdentity OTT release date: The Tovino Thomas and Trisha Krishnan-starrer is set to release on Zee5. Directed by Akhil Paul and Anas Khan, the psychological thriller will begin streaming from next week.

Coldplay in India: A rollercoaster of excitement, chaos, and disappointmentColdplay's first three concerts in India have left fans with mixed feelings. While tickets for all the five shows sold out quickly, fans all over the country complained about the issues surrounding the Mumbai concerts.

Newtopia trailer: BLACKPINK's Jisoo to headline hilarious romantic zombie dramaThe much-anticipated trailer for Newtopia is out, featuring BLACKPINK's Jisoo and actor Park Jeong-min. The duo navigates a zombie outbreak in this gripping drama based on Han Sang-woon's novel Influenza.

Sweet Dreams movie review: Mithila-Amol's film is a candy that's not sweet enoughReleased-Fri Jan 24, 2025Sweet Dreams movie review: Sweet Dreams could have been a simple romantic film, but it ends up being preachy in an attempt to mildly school the young generation about the difference between dreams and reality. However, Mithila Palkar and Amol Parashar look pretty together.

BB 18 winner Karan Veer Mehra's ex-wife, actor Nidhi Seth gets marriedTwo years after separating from Karanveer Mehra, actress Nidhi Seth remarried her boyfriend Sandiip Kummar. Recently, she shared pictures from her temple wedding.

Watch: BTS' J-hope, Rose, G-Dragon and Taeyang claim the stage at Paris eventBTS member J-hope, Blackpink's Rose, and G-Dragon and Taeyang of BigBang recently marked their presence at a Paris event. J-hope even shared photos from his performance on social media.

When Life Gives You Tangerines: Park Bo-gum, IU's K-drama to premiere on this dateThe much-anticipated K-drama, When Life Gives You Tangerines, starring Park Bo-gum and IU, will premiere on Netflix on March 7. The streaming date was shared alongside the show's first teaser.

Hisaab Barabar review: R Madhavan tries hard to save this middling filmReleased-Fri Jan 24, 2025Hisaab Barabar movie review: R Madhavan's latest, Hisaab Barabar, had the potential to deliver something raw and novel. Instead, the Ashwni Dhir directorial falls into the usual traps of the everyman story. Read our take on the film here.

Paatal Lok 2 ending explained: What's next for Hathi Ram, did he get Rs 2 crore?Paatal Lok 2 continues to captivate audiences with its intricate storyline and profound depiction of Nagaland's socio-political landscape. The series resolves its many mysteries, leaving viewers pondering Inspector Hathi Ram's future. Find out what the season's ending meant and whether there will be a third season of Paatal Lok.

Pics: Rapper Emiway Bantai marries singer-actor SwaalinaRapper Eminem Batai surprised fans as he shared photos from his intimate wedding ceremony with actor and singer Swaalina. The duo worked together in the 2023 music video, Kudi.

Ian Bohen on working with Salman Khan in Marigold, Yellowstone, Teen Wolf, Hollywood dreams Ian Bohen opened up in an exclusive chat about the emotional and dramatic finale season of Yellowstone and credited Teen Wolf for bolstering his self-assurance. He also spoke about Salman Khan, whom he co-starred in Marigold.

general news.headline: Republic Day parade: 'Nari shakti', military firepower on display at Kartavya Path Live UpdatesRepublic Day celebrations, led by President Droupadi Murmu, are underway with tens of thousands attending the grand parade at Kartavya Path. Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto is the chief guest this year.

PM Modi wears vibrant multicoloured turban for 76th Republic Day celebrationsRepublic Day 2025: The Prime Minister paired his turban with a white kurta-pyjama and a brown bandhgala jacket and pocket square for the Republic Day celebrations.

Trump wants Jordan, Egypt to take Palestinians from Gaza: Clean out whole thingPresident Donald Trump proposed relocating Palestinian refugees from Gaza to Jordan, Egypt, and other Arab nations, calling Gaza a "demolition site." He suggested building housing elsewhere for Palestinians to live "in peace."

Arvind Kejriwal questions deploying Gujarat cops for his security, BJP respondsThe security arrangement for AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal, involving police personnel from two different states, was against the law, according to sources in the Delhi Police.

Tamil predates sand, stone-age: Why India should embrace findings and dig deeperTamil Nadu's archaeology department recently released stunning evidence that Chief Minister MK Stalin said showed the Iron Age beginning there. Stalin lost no time in locating the new findings in the political context of the Aryan-versus-Dravidian debate. Regardless of who is on which side of these debates, it is time the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) ended its criminal neglect of an unfolding old civilisation. We need a massive national effort to unearth the secrets of this land. After all, Tamil Nadu is a part of India.

Tilak Varma's Dhoni-esque knock in Chennai fuels his rise as future superstarTilak Varma's heroic fifty rescued India after the star-studded top-order crumbled against England pacers. Tilak played an unbeaten 72-run knock to single-handedly help India overhaul the 166-run target.

Video: Tri-services tableau feature at Republic Day parade in a historic firstFor the first time, a tri-services tableau showcased at the Republic Day Parade, emphasising joint operations across land, air, and sea. Man claims his Apple Watch was nearly stolen at Delhi Airport, authorities reactA Gurugram-based man alleged that his Apple Watch was almost stolen during a security check at Delhi Airport's Terminal 3.

Watch: Air Force's stunning flower show at grand Republic Day parade in DelhiOn the occasion of the 76th Republic Day, Indian Air Force helicopters showered flower petals over Kartavya Path, adding splendor to the ongoing parade.

Elon Musk tells Germans to move beyond past guilt at far-right party rallyElon Musk, despite facing backlash, once again endorsed Germany's far-right AfD party, calling it the nation's "best hope". His support sparked controversy, coinciding with mass anti-AfD protests across German cities.

Pics: PM's turban to desi weapons, 76th Republic Day parade is a sight to beholdIndia marked its 76th Republic Day with a parade at Kartavya Path. The event showcased military equipment, including 125 mm smoothbore guns, 7.62 mm machine guns, 12.7 mm anti-aircraft guns, and tanks.  Agniban, a missile system, was also featured during the procession. Helicopters from the Indian Air Force carried the Indian and Indonesian flags over the venue.

Novak Djokovic shuts down doubters with 'injury proof' after semi-final exitAustralian Open: Novak Djokovic shut down his doubters who had argued that the 10-time Australian Open champion had faked his injury in the quarter-final and semi-final in the tournament. Djokovic posted an MRI of his left hamstring and asked the doubters to have a look at it.

Trophy or nothing: Sabalenka not satisfied after losing Australian Open finalAryna Sabalenka did not mince her words in expressing her disappointment after losing the Australian Open Final. Sabalenka said that she was not satisfied as no one remembered the person who came second behind the winner.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
